Financial Stress Index Signal

Market-wide financial stress and systemic risk conditions.

As of 2026-01-06

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Financial Stress Index (1) is currently in a Neutral regime as of 2025-12-26, indicating stable financial conditions. This represents a transition from a recent Bearish state.
  • Conviction Band: Medium | Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence | Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The St. Louis Fed Financial Stress Index (STLFSI4) stands at -0.5822 with a robust z-score of 0.106050 (1). This places it within the Neutral band, where STLFSI4 is not positive and the z-score is not below -0.5 (1).
  • The signal recently shifted from Bearish on 2025-12-19 to Neutral on 2025-12-26, suggesting an easing of mild stress.
  • Conditional Invalidation: The signal would reverse to Bearish if STLFSI4 rises above 0 or its robust z-score exceeds +0.5 (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Stable, Neutral financial conditions are expected to persist, supported by the current STLFSI4 level and its near-zero z-score.
  • Upside secondary: Conditions could become Bullish if STLFSI4 further declines below zero and its z-score drops below -0.5 (1).
  • Downside residual: A renewed Bearish regime would emerge if STLFSI4 turns positive or its z-score climbs above +0.5 (1).

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months). The weekly data provides a responsive gauge of financial conditions, suitable for tracking medium-term shifts (1).
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: High. The signal offers a clear and confident assessment, making it a valuable input for broader macro analysis.

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal primarily informs the liquidity and risk sentiment macro dimensions.
  • It is relevant across all business cycle positions, offering insights into systemic stress or ease.
  • It typically interacts with credit conditions (2), market volatility (3), and overall growth expectations (4).

Data & References:

  • STLFSI4, St. Louis Fed Financial Stress Index (rev. 4), latest observation 2025-12-26 (1).
  • The STLFSI4 level and its robust z-score were most influential in determining the current Neutral state (1).
  • Additional public datasets that would improve depth or reliability include the Credit Spreads Signal (5) and the VIX Market Volatility Signal (3).
